publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1072 Shirley-Anne Somerville: National Energy Efficiency Awards—That the Parliament congratulates the University of Edinburgh on winning the Energy Management in Buildings category of the National Energy Efficiency Awards 2007; notes that since 2003 the university, led by its Energy and Sustainability Office, has invested £12 million over four years to replace ageing steam systems with pioneering combined heat and power systems which now serve three of its five campuses, generating £1 million savings annually and reducing carbon emissions by over 4,000 tonnes per year; notes that the University of Edinburgh has gained an international reputation for its proactive approach to environmental sustainability, and applauds all the Scottish finalists at the National Energy Efficiency Awards for grasping the opportunity to show global leadership in our management of the challenges associated with climate change.
S3M-1072 National Energy Efficiency Awards (lodged on 20 December 2007) Michael Matheson*
S3M-1072 National Energy Efficiency Awards (lodged on 20 December 2007) Jamie Hepburn*
